==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|しょう|しょう|yomi=o}}
{{IPAchar|/sepuɕʲau/}} → {{IPAchar|/seɸuɕʲau/}} → {{IPAchar|/seuɕʲau/}} → {{IPAchar|/ɕʲɔːɕʲɔː/}} → {{IPAchar|/ɕʲoːɕʲoː/}}

From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=しょうしょう}} compound {{m|zh|攝政|tr=syep tsyeng<sup>H</sup>|lit=grasp + government}}. Compare modern {{etyl|cmn|-}} traditional {{m|zh|攝政}} and simplified {{m|zh|摄政|tr=shèzhèng||to act as a regent}}.

The [[呉音#Japanese|goon]], so likely the reading as first borrowed.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=go|しょうしょう}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|しょうしょう|kyu=攝政|hhir=せふしやう}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=しょうしょう|archaic}} the [[chief]] [[advisor]] to the emperor, similar to a [[viceroy]] or [[vizier]]

=====Synonyms=====
* {{sense|viceroy}} {{ja-r|関白|かんぱく}}

===Etymology 2===

{{wikipedia|lang=ja}}
{{wikipedia|Regency}}
</div>
{{ja-kanjitab|せつ|k1=せっ|しょう|yomi=o}}
Shift in reading of ''shōshō'' above, using the [[慣用読み#Japanese|kan'yōyomi]] of ''setsu'' for the {{ja-l|摂}} character.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=kanyoon|せっしょう|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR|acc2=0|acc2_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|せっしょう|kyu=攝政|hhira=せっしゃう}}

# a [[regent]]: one who [[rules]] in the place of a [[monarch]] because the monarch is too [[young]], [[absent]], or [[disabled]]
# [[regency]]: the [[position]] or [[station]] of a regent
# {{lb|ja|sort=せっしょう|archaic}} the [[chief]] [[advisor]] to the emperor, similar to a [[viceroy]] or [[vizier]]

=====Synonyms=====
* {{sense|viceroy}} {{ja-r|関白|かんぱく}}
